soc.message

Class SOCStatusMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.message.SOCMessage
      • soc.message.SOCStatusMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class SOCStatusMessage
extends SOCMessage
    This is a text message that shows in a status box on the client. Used for "welcome" message at initial connect to game (follows JOINCHANNELAUTH or JOINGAMEAUTH), or rejection if client can't join that game (or channel). Also used in SOCAccountClient to tell the user if their change was made successfully.

    Sent in response to any message type used by clients to request authentication and create or connect to a game or channel: SOCJoinGame, SOCJoinChannel, SOCImARobot, SOCAuthRequest, SOCNewGameWithOptionsRequest.

    Status values:

    The Status Value parameter (nonnegative integer) was added in version 1.1.06. For backwards compatibility, the status value (integer getStatusValue() ) is not sent as a parameter if it is 0. (In JSettlers older than 1.1.06, status value is always 0.) Earlier versions simply printed the entire message as text, without trying to parse anything.
    Status value back-compatibility:
    The server uses buildForVersion(int, int, String) which checks client version compatibility to avoid sending newly defined status codes/values to clients too old to understand them; older "fallback" status values are sent instead. See individual status values' javadocs.

    "Debug Is On" notification:

    In version 1.1.17 and newer, a server with debug commands enabled will send a STATUSMESSAGE right after sending its VERSION, which will include text such as "debug is on" or "debugging on". It won't send a nonzero status value, because older client versions might treat it as generic failure and disconnect.

    In version 2.0.00 and newer, the server's "debug is on" status is SV_OK_DEBUG_MODE_ON. Older clients are sent SV_OK, and the status text to older clients must include the word "debug".

    Author:
    Robert S. Thomas
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      This game version is too new for your client's version to join = 5 Server v1.1.20 and newer also send this value to SOCAccountClient if client is too old to create accounts at the server's version because of a required logon auth or other message added since that client's version.

      Client has requested joining or creating a game whose options require some optional client features, but at least one of those features or its value is too new for the client to handle = 22 Format of this status text is:
      Status string with error message
      SEP2 game name
      SEP2 optional feature(s) required by game but not implemented in client, in format returned by SOCGame.checkClientFeatures(SOCFeatureSet, boolean) This is sent when client tries to join or create a game: If sent for joining, the game name will be in the client's list of all games; if game name isn't there, this status was sent for a game creation request.

      • SV_OK

        public static final int SV_OK
        Status value constants. SV_OK = 0 : Welcome, OK to give a username and optional password.
        Since:
        1.1.06
        See Also:
        SV_NOT_OK_GENERIC, SV_OK_DEBUG_MODE_ON, Constant Field Values

      • SV_NOT_OK_GENERIC

        public static final int SV_NOT_OK_GENERIC
        SV_NOT_OK_GENERIC = 1 : Generic "not OK" status value. This is given to the client if a more specific value does not apply, or if the client's version is older than the version where the more specific value was introduced.
        Since:
        1.1.06
        See Also:
        SV_OK, Constant Field Values

      • SV_NAME_NOT_FOUND

        public static final int SV_NAME_NOT_FOUND
        Name not found in server's accounts = 2. Server version 1.1.19 and 1.1.20 never replies with this to any authentication request message type; SV_PW_WRONG is sent even if the name doesn't exist. Server v1.2.00 and higher will send this reply to any older clients which can't recognize SV_OK_SET_NICKNAME.
        Since:
        1.1.06
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SV_PW_WRONG

        public static final int SV_PW_WRONG
        Incorrect password = 3. Also used in v1.1.19 and higher for authentication replies when the account name is not found, instead of SV_NAME_NOT_FOUND.

        If no password was given but the server requires passwords (a config option in server v1.1.19 and higher), it will reply with SV_PW_REQUIRED if the client is v1.1.19 or higher, SV_PW_WRONG if lower.

        Since:
        1.1.06
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SV_NAME_IN_USE

        public static final int SV_NAME_IN_USE
        This name is already logged in = 4. In version 1.1.08 and higher, a "take over" option is used for reconnect when a client loses connection, and server doesn't realize it. A new connection can "take over" the name after a minute's timeout. For actual timeouts, see SOCServer.checkNickname.
        Since:
        1.1.06
        See Also:
        SV_NAME_NOT_ALLOWED, Constant Field Values

      • SV_CANT_JOIN_GAME_VERSION

        public static final int SV_CANT_JOIN_GAME_VERSION
        This game version is too new for your client's version to join = 5

        Server v1.1.20 and newer also send this value to SOCAccountClient if client is too old to create accounts at the server's version because of a required logon auth or other message added since that client's version.

        Server v2.0.00 and newer also send this value if client wants to join or create a game but is missing a Client Feature (from SOCFeatureSet) required by the game. This situation doesn't need its own Status Value because the server announces such games to the client with the "Cannot Join" flag prefix, and the client shouldn't have UI options to create a game with features it doesn't have.

        Since:
        1.1.06
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Cannot log in or create account due to a temporary database problem = 6
        Since:
        1.1.06

      • SV_ACCT_NOT_CREATED_ERR

        public static final int SV_ACCT_NOT_CREATED_ERR
        For account creation, an error prevented the account from being created, or server doesn't use accounts, = 8.

        To see whether a server v1.1.19 or newer uses accounts and passwords, check whether SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_ACCOUNTS is sent when the client connects.

        Since:
        1.1.06
        See Also:
        SV_ACCT_NOT_CREATED_DENIED, Constant Field Values

        public static final int SV_NEWGAME_NAME_REJECTED
        New game requested, but name of game or player does not meet standards = 12. May be because of special characters, is only digits or punctuation, etc.
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:

      • SV_NAME_TOO_LONG

        public static final int SV_NAME_TOO_LONG
        New game or auth or account-creation requested, but name of game or player is too long = 13. The text returned with this status shall include the max permitted length.

        Before v2.0.00 this status was SV_NEWGAME_NAME_TOO_LONG.

        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        SOCServer.createOrJoinGameIfUserOK(soc.communication.Connection, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, soc.game.SOCGameOptionSet), Constant Field Values

      • SV_NEWGAME_TOO_MANY_CREATED

        public static final int SV_NEWGAME_TOO_MANY_CREATED
        New game requested, but client already has created too many active games. The text returned with this status shall indicate the max number.
        Since:
        1.1.10
        See Also:
        SOCServer.createOrJoinGameIfUserOK(soc.communication.Connection, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, soc.game.SOCGameOptionSet), Constant Field Values

      • SV_NEWCHANNEL_TOO_MANY_CREATED

        public static final int SV_NEWCHANNEL_TOO_MANY_CREATED
        New chat channel requested, but client already has created too many active channels. The text returned with this status shall indicate the max number.
        Since:
        1.1.10
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SV_PW_REQUIRED

        public static final int SV_PW_REQUIRED
        Password required but missing = 16. Used if server config settings require all players to have user accounts and passwords.

        Clients older than v1.1.19 won't recognize this status value; if possible they should be sent SV_PW_WRONG instead.

        Since:
        1.1.19
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SV_ACCT_NOT_CREATED_DENIED

        public static final int SV_ACCT_NOT_CREATED_DENIED
        For account creation, the requesting user's account is not authorized to create accounts = 17.
        Since:
        1.1.19
        See Also:
        SV_ACCT_NOT_CREATED_ERR, Constant Field Values

      • SV_ACCT_CREATED_OK_FIRST_ONE

        public static final int SV_ACCT_CREATED_OK_FIRST_ONE
        For account creation, new account was created successfully and was the server's first account = 18. Normally (when not the first account) the status code returned is SV_ACCT_CREATED_OK. This separate code is provided to let the client know they must authenticate before creating any other accounts.

        This status is not sent if the server is in Open Registration mode (SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_OPEN_REG), because in that mode there's nothing special about the first account and no need to authenticate before creating others.

        Clients older than v1.1.20 won't recognize this status value; they should be sent SV_ACCT_CREATED_OK instead.

        Since:
        1.1.20
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SV_NAME_NOT_ALLOWED

        public static final int SV_NAME_NOT_ALLOWED
        Client's authentication failed because requested nickname is not allowed or is reserved: "Server", bot names like "robot 7", or "debug" when not in debug mode.

        This code would also be sent if the nickname fails SOCMessage.isSingleLineAndSafe(String), but a client's SOCMessage with that failing nickname would be malformed and not parsed at the server, so it wouldn't see a message to reply to.

        Server versions earlier than v1.2.00 would instead respond with SV_NAME_IN_USE; this status is more specific. Clients older than v1.2.00 won't recognize this status value; they will be sent SV_NOT_OK_GENERIC instead.

        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SV_OK_SET_NICKNAME

        public static final int SV_OK_SET_NICKNAME
        Client has authenticated successfully, but their case-insensitive username differs from their exact case-sensitive name in the database. To join and create games and channels, the client must update its internal nickname field.

        Status text format: exactUsername + SOCMessage.sep2_char + text to display

        When joining a game or chat channel, the message with this status is sent before SOCJoinGameAuth or (for v1.2.01 and newer) SOCJoinChannelAuth. In reply to client's SOCAuthRequest this status is sent instead of a message with status SV_OK.

        Clients older than v1.2.00 won't recognize this status value, and won't know to update their nickname once authenticated; they will instead be sent SV_NAME_NOT_FOUND with status text indicating the exact case-sensitive nickname to use.

        Bots: Server and client code assume that only human player clients, not bots or SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient, will need to handle this status value.

        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SV_OK_DEBUG_MODE_ON

        public static final int SV_OK_DEBUG_MODE_ON
        Client has connected successfully (SV_OK) and the server's Debug Mode is on. Versions older than 2.0.00 get SV_OK instead; see statusFallbackForVersion(int, int).
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SV_GAME_CLIENT_FEATURES_NEEDED

        public static final int SV_GAME_CLIENT_FEATURES_NEEDED
        Client has requested joining or creating a game whose options require some optional client features, but at least one of those features or its value is too new for the client to handle = 22

        Format of this status text is:
        Status string with error message
        SEP2 game name
        SEP2 optional feature(s) required by game but not implemented in client, in format returned by SOCGame.checkClientFeatures(SOCFeatureSet, boolean)

        This is sent when client tries to join or create a game: If sent for joining, the game name will be in the client's list of all games; if game name isn't there, this status was sent for a game creation request.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        SV_NEWGAME_OPTION_VALUE_TOONEW, Constant Field Values

      • SV_SERVER_SHUTDOWN

        public static final int SV_SERVER_SHUTDOWN
        Server broadcasts SOCStatusMessage(SV_SERVER_SHUTDOWN) at clean shutdown. Clients and bots shouldn't immediately try to reconnect when the server closes their connection. Versions older than VERSION_FOR_SV_SERVER_SHUTDOWN should instead be sent SOCBCastTextMsg so they'll visually announce the shutdown in all their games and channels.
        Since:
        2.1.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VERSION_FOR_SV_SERVER_SHUTDOWN

        public static final int VERSION_FOR_SV_SERVER_SHUTDOWN
        Minimum server version which broadcasts SOCStatusMessage(SV_SERVER_SHUTDOWN) at clean shutdown, minimum client/bot version which recognizes that status and won't immediately try to reconnect.
        Since:
        2.1.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SV_MUST_AUTH_FIRST

        public static final int SV_MUST_AUTH_FIRST
        Client has sent server a message type which requires authentication before sending, such as a channel chat message or in-game action. Client must authenticate (SOCAuthRequest or another message with nickname/password fields) for server to process that message type.
        Since:
        2.4.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • SOCStatusMessage

        public SOCStatusMessage(java.lang.String st)
        Create a StatusMessage message, with status value 0 (SV_OK).
        Parameters:
        st - the status message text. For this constructor, since status value is 0, may not contain SOCMessage.sep2 characters. This will cause parsing to fail on the remote end.

      • SOCStatusMessage

        public SOCStatusMessage(int sv,
                        java.lang.String st)
        Create a StatusMessage message, with a nonzero status value. Does not check that sv is compatible with the client it's sent to; for that check, call statusFallbackForVersion(int, int) or use buildForVersion(int, int, String) instead.
        Parameters:
        sv - status value (from constants defined here, such as SV_OK)
        st - the status message text. If sv is nonzero, you may embed SOCMessage.sep2 characters in your string, and they will be passed on for the receiver to parse.
        Since:
        1.1.06

    • Method Detail

      • buildForVersion

        public static SOCStatusMessage buildForVersion(int sv,
                                               int cliVers,
                                               java.lang.String st)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        STATUSMESSAGE sep [svalue sep2] status -- includes backwards compatibility. Calls statusValidAtVersion(int, int). if sv isn't recognized in that client version, will send SV_NOT_OK_GENERIC or another "fallback" value defined in the client.

        For details and the list of status value fallbacks, see statusFallbackForVersion(int, int).

        Replaces toCmd(int, int, String) used before v2.4.50.

        Parameters:
        sv - the status value; if 0 or less, is not output. Should be a constant such as SV_OK.
        cliVers - Client's version, same format as Version.versionNumber()
        st - the status message text. If sv is nonzero, you may embed SOCMessage.sep2 characters in your string, and they will be passed on for the receiver to parse.
        Returns:
        the status message
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a sv has no successful fallback at cliVers, such as with SV_OK_SET_NICKNAME, and the client must reauthenticate instead; the exception is thrown to prevent continued server processing as if the fallback was successful.
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • getStatus

        public java.lang.String getStatus()
        Get the status text sent to show the user. Might have details about this status and its cause.

        I18N: Server v2.0.00 and newer will localize this status text for the client, if available. Not all status codes are sent frequently enough to be localized.

        Returns:
        the status message text. Is allowed to contain SOCMessage.sep2 characters.

      • getStatusValue

        public int getStatusValue()
        Returns:
        the status value, as in SV_OK
        Since:
        1.1.06

      • toCmd

        public java.lang.String toCmd()
        STATUSMESSAGE sep [svalue sep2] status
        Specified by:
        toCmd in class SOCMessage
        Returns:
        the command string

      • toCmd

        public static java.lang.String toCmd(int sv,
                                     java.lang.String st)
        STATUSMESSAGE sep [svalue sep2] status -- does not include backwards compatibility. This method is best for sending status values SV_OK or SV_NOT_OK_GENERIC. for other newer status values, call buildForVersion(int, int, String) instead.
        Parameters:
        sv - the status value; if 0 or less, is not output. Should be a constant such as SV_OK. Remember that not all client versions recognize every status; see buildForVersion(int, int, String).
        st - the status message text. If sv is nonzero, you may embed SOCMessage.sep2 characters in your string, and they will be passed on for the receiver to parse.
        Returns:
        the command string

      • toCmd

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String toCmd(int sv,
                                                  int cliVers,
                                                  java.lang.String st)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Deprecated. Use buildForVersion(int, int, String) instead, which returns a message object instead of a String
        STATUSMESSAGE sep [svalue sep2] status -- includes backwards compatibility. Calls statusValidAtVersion(int, int). if sv isn't recognized in that client version, will send SV_NOT_OK_GENERIC or another "fallback" value defined in the client.

        For details and the list of status value fallbacks, see statusFallbackForVersion(int, int).

        Parameters:
        sv - the status value; if 0 or less, is not output. Should be a constant such as SV_OK.
        cliVers - Client's version, same format as Version.versionNumber()
        st - the status message text. If sv is nonzero, you may embed SOCMessage.sep2 characters in your string, and they will be passed on for the receiver to parse.
        Returns:
        the command string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a sv has no successful fallback at cliVers, such as with SV_OK_SET_NICKNAME, and the client must reauthenticate instead; the exception is thrown to prevent continued server processing as if the fallback was successful.
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        statusFallbackForVersion(int, int)

      • statusValidAtVersion

        public static boolean statusValidAtVersion(int statusValue,
                                           int cliVersion)
        Is this status value defined in this version? If not, SV_NOT_OK_GENERIC should be sent instead. A different fallback value can be sent instead if the client is new enough to understand it; for example instead of SV_ACCT_CREATED_OK_FIRST_ONE, send SV_ACCT_CREATED_OK.

        See statusFallbackForVersion(int, int) to check client version and find a compatible status value, as the server may need to do with older clients.

        Parameters:
        statusValue - status value (from constants defined here, such as SV_OK)
        cliVersion - Client's version, same format as Version.versionNumber(); below 1.1.06, only 0 (SV_OK) is allowed. If cliVersion > ourVersion, will act as if cliVersion == ourVersion.
        Since:
        1.1.07

      • statusFallbackForVersion

        public static int statusFallbackForVersion(int sv,
                                           int cliVersion)
        Is this status value defined at this version? Check client version and if not, find a compatible status value.

        Status value fallbacks:

        See individual status values' javadocs for details.
        • SV_OK_DEBUG_MODE_ON falls back to SV_OK
        • SV_PW_REQUIRED falls back to SV_PW_WRONG
        • SV_ACCT_CREATED_OK_FIRST_ONE falls back to SV_ACCT_CREATED_OK
        • SV_GAME_CLIENT_FEATURES_NEEDED falls back to SV_NEWGAME_OPTION_VALUE_TOONEW
        • SV_OK_SET_NICKNAME has no successful fallback, the client must be sent SV_NAME_NOT_FOUND and must reauthenticate; throws IllegalArgumentException
        • All others fall back to SV_NOT_OK_GENERIC
        • In case the fallback value is also not recognized at the client, toCmd(..) will fall back again to something more generic
        • Clients before v1.1.06 will be sent the status text st only, without the sv parameter which was added in 1.1.06
        Parameters:
        sv - the status value; should be a constant such as SV_OK.
        cliVersion - Client's version, same format as Version.versionNumber()
        Returns:
        sv if valid at cliVersion, or the most applicable status for that version.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a sv has no successful fallback at cliVersion, such as with SV_OK_SET_NICKNAME, and the client must reauthenticate instead; the exception is thrown to prevent continued server processing as if the fallback was successful.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        statusValidAtVersion(int, int)

      • parseDataStr

        public static SOCStatusMessage parseDataStr(java.lang.String s)
        Parse the command String into a StatusMessage message. If status is nonzero, you may embed SOCMessage.sep2 characters in your string, and they will be passed on to the receiver.
        Parameters:
        s - the String to parse
        Returns:
        a StatusMessage message, or null if the data is garbled

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get a delimited human-readable form of this message, starting with optional sv= if not 0.

        Before v2.4.50, fields were comma-separated; that version changed to use standard '|' separator.

        Specified by:
        toString in class SOCMessage
        Returns:
        a human readable form of the message
        See Also:
        SOCMessage.toCmd()
